Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); 20TH DYNASTY ?; 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after)
Name: Lid of canopic jar
Description: This lid of a canopic jar in terracotta comes from the excavations of the Egypt Exploration Fund at Abydos in 1900. The head of the canine is distinguished by an upwards tilted muzzle and by its very large pointed ears. The eyes are made of small balls of clay, emphasized by  yellow lines. The wig is ornamented by several horizontal and vertical lines of the same colour. This type of lid probably dates from the end of the New Kingdom.
